intro: Schima sericans var. sericans, commonly known as the Chinese tallow tree, is a deciduous evergreen shrub or small tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Theaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves that are dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers followed by orange to red berries that contain a single seed. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other regions, sometimes becoming invasive. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it adaptable to various garden environments.
